sentences.en: David's mother was unstable and moody.
sentences.cn: 戴维的妈妈情绪不稳定，心情也不好。

sentences.en: He became moody and unreasonable , flailing out at Katherine at the slightest excuse.
sentences.cn: 他变得喜怒无常、不可理喻, 为点鸡毛蒜皮的小事就殴打凯瑟琳.

sentences.en: He can be rather moody at times.
He relapsed into a moody silence.
sentences.cn: 他又重新陷于忧郁的沉默中.

sentences.en: I'd never marry that - girl, she's so moody.
sentences.cn: 我决不会和那女孩结婚的, 她太易怒了.

sentences.en: It is difficult to predict his reaction because he is so moody.
sentences.cn: 他如此喜怒无常,所以很难预知其反应如何.

sentences.en: Keith had seemed moody all morning.
sentences.cn: 基思好像整个早上都不高兴。

sentences.en: Lewis was moody and brilliantly clever.
sentences.cn: 刘易斯喜怒无常，但是非常聪明。

sentences.en: Moody people are very difficult to deal with.
sentences.cn: 喜怒无常的人很难打交道。

sentences.en: She had imagination enough to be moody.
sentences.cn: 她越想心情越感到忧郁.

sentences.en: This also made him moody and bad - tempered, a trait that would persist and lose him friends.
sentences.cn: 这也使得他闷闷不乐,脾气暴躁, 长此以往,就和朋友们疏远了.

sentences.en: This evening Paul had been moody and perverse.
sentences.cn: 这天晚上保罗怏怏不乐,很反常.

sentences.en: When he came, he was silent and moody, and after a few sarcastic remarks he went away.
sentences.cn: 他来时默默无言,郁郁不乐, 冷嘲热讽一通之后就走了.

sentences.en: When Hurstwood came, Carrie was moody.
sentences.cn: 嘉莉正在闷闷不乐,赫斯渥回来了.

sentences.en: When Hurstwood came, Larrie was moody.
sentences.cn: 当赫思渥回家的时候, 嘉莉正在闷闷不乐.

trans.tran_cn: 喜怒无常的，忧悒的，（无缘无故）不高兴的，脾气坏的
trans.tran_en: often changing quickly from being in a good temper to being in a bad temper
